title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in Build 20011106, the context for nested classes is not set correctly. Currently, when a .java file is open in the editor and the new class button is clicked, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank. It should default to the current type in the editor.
OB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard is blank when a .java file is open in the editor and a nested class is being created.
SR: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type in the editor when a .java file is open and a nested class is being created.
